Configuring Boot Policy

The boot policy determines the following:

 • Configuration of the boot device

 • Location from which the server boots

 • Order in which boot devices are invoked

To configure the boot policy, perform the following:

 1. Select the Organization from the drop-down list. By default, root is displayed.

 2. Enter the Number of boot policies in the text box and click Add to generate the boot policy.

Figure 7-2 Boot Policy

 3. Click Config to configure the boot policy and order in which the boot devices are invoked. The following screen appears.

Figure 7-3 Config Boot Policy

 4. In the LAN Boot Policy, click the icon to add the generate the Name, Description, Order, vNIC and type of LAN. On creating the LAN policy, the boot order is generated. Table 7-1 lists the elements in the LAN Boot Policy.

Note LAN Boot Policy will have a primary and secondary policies. You cannot add more than two policies.

Table 7-1 Elements in the LAN Boot Policy

Item

Description

Name

Lists the name of vNIC.

Description

Lists the description of vNIC

Order

Lists the order of the vNIC

vNIC Templates

Select the vNIC template from the drop-down to connect to the Virtual Interface Card.

Type

Lists the primary or secondary LAN boot. If the primary fails, the server attempts to boot from the secondary.

 5. Drag and drop the elements to reorder the boot devices.

 6. Click Save to save the changes.

Note You can select the desired Local Disk in addition to the LAN Boot Policy.

 7. Click Save and next to proceed further.

To configure a SAN Boot Policy, perform the following:

 1. In the SAN Boot Policy, click the icon to add the generate the Name, Description, Order, vHBA and type and target of SAN. On creating the SAN policy, the boot order is generated. Table 7-1 lists the elements in the SAN Boot Policy.

Note SAN Boot Policy will have a primary and secondary policies. You cannot add more than two policies.

Table 7-2 Elements in the LAN Boot Policy

Item

Description

Name

Lists the name of vHBA.

Description

Lists the description of vHBA

Order

Lists the order of the vHBA

vHBA

Select the vHBA from the drop-down to connect to the Virtual Host Bus Adapter.

Type

Lists the primary or secondary SAN boot. If the primary fails, the server attempts to boot from the secondary.

Add Target

Click Add Target to associate one SAN target with its parent.

 2. Drag and drop the elements to reorder the boot devices.

Figure 7-4 LAN & SAN Boot Policy

 3. Click Save to save the changes.

Note SAN and Local Disk cannot be configured at same time.

 4. Click Save and next to proceed further.
